newsitem.title: USA: U.S. agency seeks to join UPS suit - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: U.S. agency seeks to join UPS suit - WSJ.

text.p: The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is seeking to join a class-action racial discrimination lawsuit against United Parcel Service of America Inc, according ot the Wall Street Journal.
In Monday's electronic edition, the Journal said the EEOC filed a motion in St. Louis federal court seeking to join the lawsuit filed by three African-American managers.
The three managers accuse the company of refusing to promote qualified blacks to executive positions with higher pay and wider responsibilities.
The agency's request must be approved by the presiding judge.
